metadata.Title: CVE-2021-30560 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Use after free in Blink XSLT in Google Chrome prior to 91.0.4472.164 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-30560` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxslt1.1 - 1.1.34-4ubuntu0.20.04.1
xsltproc - 1.1.34-4ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: alexmurray> The Debian chromium source package is called chromium-browser in Ubuntu mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 19.10, the chromium-browser package is just a script that installs the Chromium snap

criterions.comment: libxslt package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.1.34-4ubuntu0.20.04.1').
